author: syadavcv
body:
Hi,
Context: I am running a Function App 3.0 language C# 
I added nuget package Microsoft.powershell.sdk in hope that i can run powershell commands in c#
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54054779/83961750-be16d080-a8b3-11ea-8604-d50f3d47206b.png)
reason i chose C# because i want to do some Azure Active Direcytory operations. 
Everything is tried in visual studio 2019 and soon planning to publish. 
Issue:
I have put this code 
```
   using (PowerShell ps = PowerShell.Create())
                {
                    ps.AddCommand("Get-Command");
                    var obj = ps.Invoke();
```

and found lot of commands  including all the AzureRM module commands needed for operation in Azure  Active Directory 

but when i tried to run the below code.

```
ps.AddCommand("Get-AzureRmTenant");
                    var ten1 = ps.Invoke();
```

It gives below error and also when i tried to run` Import-Module AzureRM.Profile` it gives incorrect cmdlet error. So can someone please help us what can be done in function app C# using powershell and what are the restriction . 
```
"ClassName": "System.Management.Automation.CommandNotFoundException",
    "Message": "The 'Get-AzureRmTenant' command was found in the module 'AzureRM.Profile', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module AzureRM.Profile'.",
    "Data": null,
    "InnerException": {
        "ClassName": "System.Management.Automation.CmdletInvocationException",
        "Message": "One or more errors occurred. (The getter method should be public, not void, static, and have one parameter of the type PSObject.)",
        "Data": null,
        "InnerException": {
            "ClassName": "System.AggregateException",
            "Message": "One or more errors occurred.",
            "Data": null,
```

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: AzureRM doesn't work in PowerShell Core/7.  You need to use `Get-AzTenet` from `Az.Accounts`.  The `Az` module is the newer, Core compatible module that the Azure team put out.

comments.author: syadavcv
comments.body:
Getting same kind of error
```
{
    "ClassName": "System.Management.Automation.CommandNotFoundException",
    "Message": "The term 'Get-AzTenant' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.\r\nCheck the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.",
    "Data": null,
    "InnerException": null,
    "HelpURL": null,

    "RemoteStackTraceString": null,

    "WatsonBuckets": null,

    "CommandName": "Get-AzTenant"
```

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: It's a separate module that would need to be installed.

comments.author: syadavcv
comments.body:
How can we install? the  install-module and import-module command does not work in C# powershell code.
basically we cannot bring packages from powershell galley.
 

is there any way to add nuget packagae in C# project , then use in powershell

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body: From a quick google it [looks like you can upload files directly](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/using-powershell-modules-in-azure-functions/).  So you could upload the module you want to use I'm guessing.  Maybe someone else experienced with Azure Functions can chime in, but that's a question better suited for Azure's support staff.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Azure Function App 3.0  C#  : commands/modules not available on using Microsoft.powershell.sdk nuget
